The Lenovo IdeaPad 720s (AMD) is a laptop computer with a 13.3" screen, AMD Ryzenâ„¢ processor, webcam, microphone, audio in/out, 80211ac wireless card with Bluetooth 4.1, 1 USB 3.0 Type-C (DP & Power Delivery), 1 x USB 3.0 Type-C (DP), 2 USB3 ports, and a fingerprint reader.

CPU/APU-wise, Linux support for the 720s is in decent shape since kernel ~4.15 (CPU and GPU temperatures per lm_sensors); the more recent the better. Its rtl8821ce WLAN and Bluetooth chip has no mainlined driver (as of 4.17), but rtl8821ce-dkms-gitAUR comes to rescue here.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: Before installing, disable Secure Boot in the BIOS. You can access the BIOS by pressing F2 at the Splash screen. The boot menu can also be accessed by pressing F12.

sections.title: Video
sections.content:
X works natively with a current linux and xf86-video-amdgpu.

If you are having video issues with only the xf86-video-amdgpu installed, also install the AMD PRO package amdgpu-pro-oglpAUR. See AMDGPU

sections.title: Wireless
sections.content:
The rtl8821ce-dkms-gitAUR wireless driver is required in order for Wi-Fi and Bluetooth to work.

Sometimes upon reboot, rfkill may block wireless communications. To unblock, run : rfkill unblock all.

Active bluetooth may lock up the PC on lid close/suspend, then rfkill block bluetooth.

sections.title: Function keys
sections.content: No dedicated keys. The Fn functions on the F1 to F12 keys are correctly recognized by X11 and work out of the box (Touchpad on/off etc.). The default state can be inverted in the BIOS menu.

sections.title: ACPI annoyances
sections.content: ttys get filled with massive amounts of ACPI complaints, and are unusable as such. Mitigate by passing the pci=noaer kernel commandline option.

sections.title: CPU soft lockup
sections.content:
The mwait cpu instruction can cause a CPU soft lockup.

To fix the issue, add idle=nomwait to kernel parameters.
